article.title: Image Milnor number and $\mathscr A_e$-codimension for maps between weighted homogeneous irreducible curves

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula calculates the Milnor number of what? \n\n μ(Χ, 0) = (d1···dn−1 (d1 + ··· + dn−1 - W1 - ··· - Wn)/W1... Wn) – + 1
choices: A weighted homogeneous curve in n-dimensional space
A weighted homogeneous isolated complete intersection singularity (ICIS) of dimension one
A weighted homogeneous hypersurface in n-dimensional space

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the condition for this simplified Milnor number formula to hold?\n\nμ(X, 0) =  (d₁ + ··· + dn−1 - W₁ - ··· - Wn + 1)/(W1... Wn)
choices: The weighted homogeneous ICIS must be a hypersurface
The weighted homogeneous ICIS must be irreducible
The weighted homogeneous ICIS must be smooth
The weighted homogeneous ICIS must have a conductor equal to 1

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula expresses the A-codimension of a map germ f between which objects?\n\nA- codim(X, f) = dimc (Ox,0/(J1, J2))μχ + dimc (JgOX,0/JgOY,0)
choices: A smooth curve and a weighted homogeneous curve
An irreducible weighted homogeneous curve and its image under f
An arbitrary plane curve and a weighted homogeneous curve
A weighted homogeneous ICIS of any dimension and its image under f

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula defines the image Milnor number μ₁(f) of a map germ f. What does this number represent geometrically?\n\nμ₁(f) = μ(Y, 0) + μ(X, 0)/2
choices: The number of double points in a generic perturbation of the image curve (Y,0)
The number of 1-spheres in the homotopy type of the image of a stable perturbation of f
The intersection multiplicity of the curve (X,0) and its image (Y,0) at the origin
The difference between the Tjurina numbers of the curves (X,0) and (Y,0)
